required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Participation of Breast Milk Feeding Mothers in Research
clinical_study.official_title: Participation of Breast Milk Feeding Mothers in Research

brief_summary.textblock: To assess concerns and barriers for measuring milk intake of breast fed infants using the remote food photography method and SmartIntake smartphone application. These data will 1) provide support for further development of the Infant RFPM and 2) provide important preliminary data in a National Institutes of Health grant application being developed and assess the prevalence of exclusive breastfeeding and complementary breastfeeding in the study population.

detailed_description.textblock: Study participation will be the completion of an anonymous, online survey powered by HIPAA compliant REDCap database. The survey will be made available to potential participants through the internet. The survey will take approximately five minutes to complete. The expected duration of recruitment and completion of the study is six months.

primary_outcome.description: Receptivity for measuring milk intake for 5-7 days using a smartphone app

secondary_outcome.description: Receptivity for expressing human breast milk to assess milk intake for 5-7 days

other_outcome.description: Prevalence of breastfeeding in the survey population (exclusive, in combination with infant formula, in combination with other foods)
Method of feeding (breast, expressed human milk in an infant feeding bottle, combination of feeding methods)

arm_group.description: Any individual may complete this survey

study_pop.textblock: Subjects will be recruited from the community via print, electronic, and social media. Any individual may take the survey.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any individual may take the survey.
Exclusion Criteria:
